definition: to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
variant of 舉|举[ju3]
surname Bu
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
abbr. for Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]/surname Wei
to preserve/to maintain/to hold together/dimension/vitamin (abbr. for 維生素|维生素[wei2 sheng1 su4])
difficult/hard/hardship

sentences.english: Many years later, Susan became a difficult person.
sentences.chinese: 很多年之后，素心成了举步维艰的人。

sentences.english: Are you finding it hard to face life on your own?
sentences.chinese: 是否独自面对的生活让你觉得举步维艰？

sentences.english: Today we will look at the results of slogging through life under that extra weight.
sentences.chinese: 结果今天我们将看到在不必要的重负下生活举步维艰。

sentences.english: Jung learned just how difficult in the fall of 2005.
sentences.chinese: 2005年秋季对彬娴来说，真可谓是举步维艰。

sentences.english: That made our life very hard.
sentences.chinese: 这使公司发展举步维艰。

sentences.english: Sir Alex Ferguson admits a glut of injuries has unsettled Manchester United this season.
sentences.chinese: 弗格森爵士承认伤兵满营让球队举步维艰。

sentences.english: Aircraft production continued to plod along at an agonizingly slow pace.
sentences.chinese: 飞机制造业仍旧举步维艰，发展速度之缓很让人头疼。

sentences.english: The force of reaction made change difficult.
sentences.chinese: 反动势力使得改革举步维艰。

definition: to have difficulty walking (idiom)/to walk with difficulty
awkward situation/predicament
predicament/plight
unable to move a single step (idiom)/to be in an (extremely) difficult situation
stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
lit. pulling on the lapels exposes the elbows (idiom)/strapped for cash/unable to make ends meet
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
dilemma/predicament/difficult situation
lit. as if walking on thin ice (idiom)/fig. to be extremely cautious/to be skating on thin ice
difficult/hard/challenging
tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
to stand still without advancing (idiom); to hesitate and hold back
to steadily deteriorate
to add hail to snow (idiom); one disaster on top of another/to make things worse in a bad situation
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
danger lurks on every side (idiom)
